sub_title: Freelance native English writer (Dutch speaker) - advancing sustainability strategies, technology, science, and culture
summary:
I’m Larae Malooly, a journalist, writer, editor, and powerful communicator based in The Netherlands. I research and write about science, sustainability, technology, and culture for mission-driven organisations like Metabolic and Elsevier.

Some of my favourite topics include regenerative agriculture, sustainable industry, digital product passports, issues such as scarce metals and SU plastic, and the intersection of grassroots conservation with top-down policy. 

My innate environmental and social conscience drives an analytical mindset and a penchant for translating topical issues into palatable and useful articles, websites, white papers, and reports. My specialty lies in grasping complex topics — such as systems, academic and scientific research, current affairs, and social trends — and weaving together an engaging story that everyone can understand. I use comprehensive research, interviewing skills, and lively storytelling methods to make engaging content. 

My copywriting skills include writing news articles, reports, online content, press releases, social media and creative texts, commercial materials, and ghostwriting books for organisations and private entities. 

Having been on-camera as a reporter and announcer for CBS in the United States, I enjoy engaging an audience and know how to create content that appeals to diverse groups. New experiences, cultures, and technological advances inspire me tremendously.

treasury_media.title: Article sample: How can the public and private sectors build regenerative, circular cities?
treasury_media.description: Amazing thought leaders from both the private and social sectors shared how their own organisations and businesses are researching and investing in a better future for our cities, the environment, and society. I wrote this article for Metabolic about the solutions they are already putting into practice. How they operate cleaner and smarter is so impressive!

treasury_media.title: Writer, editor, translator for City of Amsterdam
treasury_media.description: Full book in PDF. I served the City of Amsterdam as the editor and translator (Dutch to English) of StartupCity, a book about private-public partnership in the tech startup ecosystem, describing local government's role in attracting and developing startups.

treasury_media.title: Amsterdam Copywriter
treasury_media.description: For a portfolio of my published articles, visit my personal writer's website.

treasury_media.title: News article: Secret NATO headquarters declassified
treasury_media.description: A former NATO HQ that operated secretly for decades in the ancient hills near Maastrichts in the southern Netherlands is declassified for the first time in its history. I joined one of the first tours of the eerie tunnels that remain.

treasury_media.title: Demo Reel: My work as a reporter and announcer for KDBC CBS News in El Paso, Texas
treasury_media.description: This is an 11-minute resume-tape beginning with a montage of various on-air news stand ups and lives, followed by several packaged stories showing different aspects of Larae's experience as a general assignments and city beat reporting for KDBC CBS 4 News in El Paso, Texas from 2000-2002.

publications.name: StartupCity: The Role of Government in Entrepreneurial Ecosystems

Globalism, Terrorism, and the Israeli-Palestinian Conflict

profile_positions.description:
I focus on written content relating to sustainability and circular economy projects (principles, scientific reports, and topical news). I coordinate an editorial pipeline that furthers Metabolic’s work, focusing on our impacts in agriculture, industry, cities, products, finance, governance, and mindset. The role involves:

● Providing scientific writing, editing, and communications support: working closely with the Metabolic team to gather in-depth knowledge of their work, translating academic and scientific research into palatable stories.

● Researching and writing thought pieces and original content, and developing pieces
from the ecosystem, both to publish on the Metabolic website and to pitch to target
media.

● Encouraging and facilitating writing within Metabolic’s team of subject matter experts, through interviews, narrative guidance, written assistance, and editing for structure, grammar, style, and tone.

● Writing and sending the Metabolic Monthly newsletter, based on projects and news
articles developed that month.

● Editing content from across the ecosystem and ensuring it meets Metabolic’s brand
standards. This includes team bios, project pages, articles, reports, and more.

● Managing media outreach and creation of press releases and op-eds.

● Working with partners and clients to craft joint messaging and campaigns, especially as it relates to press and content.

● Working with external experts (proofreaders, translators, writers, or editors) when
necessary.

● Supporting the development of other forms of content, particularly graphics, as needed.
profile_positions.title: Science Writer

profile_positions.description: I write articles for Metabolic, as well as edit and translate scientific reports about sustainability and the circular economy for this dynamic consultancy. Topics include renewable energy, technology, critical metals supply, agrifood & biodiversity, green cities, and how scientific developments within these fields apply to governance, finance, and industry.
profile_positions.title: Writer

profile_positions.description: I write website content and script video content for Elsevier's Strategic Partners suite of publishing and data-driven analytical services that promote research institutions, academics, and governments.
profile_positions.title: Writer

profile_positions.description: I serve as a writer and editor for Catalystas Consulting, an international development consulting firm, on an ongoing basis. Working on their proposals and research findings, I regularly assist their international team of consultants in completing crucial documentation of policy and social programmes in the Middle East and Africa that support women and young people.
profile_positions.title: Writer

profile_positions.location: writing worldwide, based in the Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Storytelling is an art, and I excel at interviewing people for candid and engaging copy for many platforms: online, print, commercial text, point-of-sale, journals, and ghostwriting. 

I craft writing assignments on everything cultural and criminal, tangible and ethereal. My voice hints at the cynical and humorous, and is always effective, informative, and colorful. Most published writing in the past was for magazines and newspapers in Texas, New Mexico, and Arizona. However I am currently based in Amsterdam, The Netherlands with access to many facets of life here: NGOs, European Union affairs, performances and artists who tour through the area. Travel, culture, history, politics, social issues and trends are my favorite topics to cover as a journalist, but as a writer I also enjoy creative scriptwriting and unique projects with dynamic people. 

.
profile_positions.title: Copywriter, Journalist, Editor

profile_positions.description:
Scientific writer for an advanced, anti-aging supplement. Yoxlo is producing Youngenin, a unique protein inhibitor that can decrease the inevitable in us all as we age: chronic, low-grade inflammation. Inflammation is pivotal in the pathology of almost all age-related diseases. The less inflammation, the later the onset of disease, and therefore, the younger we all age. 

Working closely with founder Dr. Stef Verlinden, I wrote the website by delving into the scientific processes behind low NLRP3 levels found in long-lived mice (in labs) and healthy centenarians (in the real world) --both of which stay younger for longer because, uniquely, both block IL-1β. Read more about that here: https://yoxlo.com/approach

Our lifespans are longer than ever. And soon, so will our healthspans.
profile_positions.title: Science Writer

profile_positions.description: I write about art, photography, exhibitions, design, performing arts, popular culture, architecture, and urban planning for the global book distributor's website. Filling in for Dutton Hauhart of ReitzInk. Founded in 1976, Idea Books is a specialist wholesaler and distributor of books, exhibition catalogues, and DVDs on contemporary architecture, art, photography, design, fashion, and film.
profile_positions.title: Copywriter

profile_positions.description: Look up Metabolic, Enel North America, Closed Loop Partners, Volans, or Pyxera Global and realise that they are giants in the field of sustainable business, urban development, energy, and investment. They came together for a powerhouse webinar on how their work helps to shape circular cities, a city that operates with less waste, better value chain practices, and an inclusive society. Sound like a utopia? It's not. Just click the article or watch the webinar: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tkOLq6axqAo&t=6s
profile_positions.title: Copywriter

profile_positions.description:
I am writing and conceptualising copy for Zero Emissions World, an NGO that is actively implementing UN Sustainable Development Goals with two great missions: a massive reforestation project and providing solar panels to schools and clinics in the poorest communities in Mozambique. 

I'm helping to build the website content from the ground up to attract donors, members, corporate sponsorship, and celebrity endorsement from ZEW's already amazing global network who genuinely want to shape a cleaner, decarbonised world. 

This involves strategising with the founders about our message, tone of voice, and narrative so that they match with the NGO's business model and recruit the most people for a positive environmental impact. 

The result will be a captivating website and the presentations, reports, social media, and blog posts  that I write to grow Zero Emissions World's army of Warriors and Leagues who campion a better world.
profile_positions.title: Copywriter

profile_positions.description:
As a Tour Director, I accompany student tour groups of up to 50 people while they tour parts of Europe from eight days to three weeks. I ensure the entire tour goes smoothly, from logistics to reservations to planning key events. I am an educator and guide, making their first European trip exciting and interesting, linking their lives in North America to life in Europe. I am also a confidante and problem-solver for the entire group on both a professional and personal level, connecting with the people on a deeply personal level even after the tour has ended. 
The primary achievement has been inspiring young Americans to travel and become global citizens, helping them understand different cultures and issues around the world. Finally, the duties of managing teenagers, their complex tour itineraries, dealing with members of the travel industry sharpened my leadership, diplomatic, and problem-solving skills.
profile_positions.title: Tour Director

profile_positions.description: Responsible for web content and internal and external communications to more than 600 members in the youth travel industry.
profile_positions.title: PR and Communications Manager

company.name: International Docmentary Film Festival Amsterdam (IDFA) and Int'l Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR)

volunteer_experiences.description: To support independent film and documentary work, I volunteer annually at the International Documentary Film Festival Amsteram (IDFA) in November and at International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR) in January. All roles involve working directly with the public in the cinemas that host the festivals.
The Child Helpline International used my data analysis and copywriting skills to contribute to their Regional Consultation reports for two regions: Asia Pacific and Latin America.
